trans-unit.source: Token Issuance Endpoint Errors
trans-unit.target: Token Issuance Endpoint Errors

trans-unit.source: Token Issuance Endpoint Errors
trans-unit.target: Token Issuance Endpoint Errors

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD token issuance endpoint uses HTTP error codes because the client calls this endpoint directly.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD token issuance endpoint uses HTTP error codes because the client calls this endpoint directly.

trans-unit.source: This differs from the authorization endpoint that is loaded in a browser.
trans-unit.target: This differs from the authorization endpoint that is loaded in a browser.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD token issuance endpoint uses the following error codes.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD token issuance endpoint uses the following error codes.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the HTTP status code, the Azure AD token issuance endpoint returns a JSON document with objects that describe the error.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the HTTP status code, the Azure AD token issuance endpoint returns a JSON document with objects that describe the error.

trans-unit.source: For example, the Azure AD token issuance endpoint returns an error like the following one when the value of the <parameterReference>client_id</parameterReference> parameter in the request is invalid.
trans-unit.target: For example, the Azure AD token issuance endpoint returns an error like the following one when the value of the <parameterReference>client_id</parameterReference> parameter in the request is invalid.

trans-unit.source: HTTP Status Codes
trans-unit.target: HTTP Status Codes

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the HTTP status codes that the token issuance endpoint returns.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the HTTP status codes that the token issuance endpoint returns.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, the error code is sufficient to describe the response, but in case of errors, you will need to parse the accompanying JSON document and examine its error code.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, the error code is sufficient to describe the response, but in case of errors, you will need to parse the accompanying JSON document and examine its error code.

trans-unit.source: HTTP Code
trans-unit.target: HTTP Code

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Default HTTP code.
trans-unit.target: Default HTTP code.

trans-unit.source: Used in most cases.
trans-unit.target: Used in most cases.

trans-unit.source: Authentication failed.
trans-unit.target: Authentication failed.

trans-unit.source: For example, the request is missing the <parameterReference>client_secret</parameterReference> parameter.
trans-unit.target: For example, the request is missing the <parameterReference>client_secret</parameterReference> parameter.

trans-unit.source: Authorization failed.
trans-unit.target: Authorization failed.

trans-unit.source: For example, the user does not have permission to access the resource.
trans-unit.target: For example, the user does not have permission to access the resource.

trans-unit.source: An internal error has occurred at the service.
trans-unit.target: An internal error has occurred at the service.

trans-unit.source: Retry the request.
trans-unit.target: Retry the request.

trans-unit.source: JSON Document Objects in the Error Response
trans-unit.target: JSON Document Objects in the Error Response

trans-unit.source: When an error occurs, in addition to the HTTP Code, the Azure AD token issuance endpoint returns a JSON document.
trans-unit.target: When an error occurs, in addition to the HTTP Code, the Azure AD token issuance endpoint returns a JSON document.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the object in the document.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the object in the document.

trans-unit.source: JSON Object
trans-unit.target: JSON Object

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: error
trans-unit.target: error

trans-unit.source: An error code value defined in Section 5.2 of the <externalLink><linkText>OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: An error code value defined in Section 5.2 of the <externalLink><linkText>OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The next table describes the error codes that Azure AD returns.
trans-unit.target: The next table describes the error codes that Azure AD returns.

trans-unit.source: error_description
trans-unit.target: error_description

trans-unit.source: A more detailed description of the error.
trans-unit.target: A more detailed description of the error.

trans-unit.source: This message is not intended to be end-user friendly.
trans-unit.target: This message is not intended to be end-user friendly.

trans-unit.source: timestamp
trans-unit.target: timestamp

trans-unit.source: The date and time that the error occurred in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
trans-unit.target: The date and time that the error occurred in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

trans-unit.source: trace_id
trans-unit.target: trace_id

trans-unit.source: An ID that identifies the error trace.
trans-unit.target: An ID that identifies the error trace.

trans-unit.source: correlation_id
trans-unit.target: correlation_id

trans-unit.source: A value generated by the client.
trans-unit.target: A value generated by the client.

trans-unit.source: This ID is included in the JSON error document when the request to the token issuance enpoint includes this value in the <embeddedLabel>client-request-id</embeddedLabel> header.
trans-unit.target: This ID is included in the JSON error document when the request to the token issuance enpoint includes this value in the <embeddedLabel>client-request-id</embeddedLabel> header.

trans-unit.source: This ID may be used by other calls in the same session.
trans-unit.target: This ID may be used by other calls in the same session.

trans-unit.source: error_codes
trans-unit.target: error_codes

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of error codes that map to different conditions of the service.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of error codes that map to different conditions of the service.

trans-unit.source: Do not use these codes in your application logic.
trans-unit.target: Do not use these codes in your application logic.

trans-unit.source: However, you can use them to diagnose an issue and search for information online by error code.
trans-unit.target: However, you can use them to diagnose an issue and search for information online by error code.

trans-unit.source: JSON Document Error Code Values
trans-unit.target: JSON Document Error Code Values

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the error codes (<parameterReference>error</parameterReference> parameter values) that the Azure AD token issuance endpoint returns.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the error codes (<parameterReference>error</parameterReference> parameter values) that the Azure AD token issuance endpoint returns.

trans-unit.source: Error Code
trans-unit.target: Error Code

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Client Action
trans-unit.target: Client Action

trans-unit.source: invalid_request
trans-unit.target: invalid_request

trans-unit.source: Protocol error, such as a missing required parameter.
trans-unit.target: Protocol error, such as a missing required parameter.

trans-unit.source: Fix and resubmit the request.
trans-unit.target: Fix and resubmit the request.

trans-unit.source: For reference, use the protocol documentation and <link xlink:href="6c3e8f37-06ed-439e-bc2d-d6a318f32639" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Grant Flow</link>.
trans-unit.target: For reference, use the protocol documentation and <link xlink:href="6c3e8f37-06ed-439e-bc2d-d6a318f32639" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Grant Flow</link>.

trans-unit.source: This is a development error is typically caught during initial testing.
trans-unit.target: This is a development error is typically caught during initial testing.

trans-unit.source: invalid_grant
trans-unit.target: invalid_grant

trans-unit.source: The authorization grant (or its parameters) or refresh token is invalid, expired, or revoked.
trans-unit.target: The authorization grant (or its parameters) or refresh token is invalid, expired, or revoked.

trans-unit.source: Fix and resubmit the request.
trans-unit.target: Fix and resubmit the request.

trans-unit.source: For reference, use the protocol documentation and <link xlink:href="6c3e8f37-06ed-439e-bc2d-d6a318f32639" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Grant Flow</link>.
trans-unit.target: For reference, use the protocol documentation and <link xlink:href="6c3e8f37-06ed-439e-bc2d-d6a318f32639" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Grant Flow</link>.

trans-unit.source: This is a development error is typically caught during initial testing.
trans-unit.target: This is a development error is typically caught during initial testing.

trans-unit.source: unauthorized_client
trans-unit.target: unauthorized_client

trans-unit.source: The authenticated client is not authorized to use this authorization grant type.
trans-unit.target: The authenticated client is not authorized to use this authorization grant type.

trans-unit.source: This usually occurs when the client application is not registered in Azure AD or is not added to the user's Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: This usually occurs when the client application is not registered in Azure AD or is not added to the user's Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: The application can prompt the user with instruction for installing the application and adding it to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The application can prompt the user with instruction for installing the application and adding it to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Application Access</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=286007%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Application Access</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=286007%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: invalid_client
trans-unit.target: invalid_client

trans-unit.source: Client authentication failed.
trans-unit.target: Client authentication failed.

trans-unit.source: The client credentials are not valid.
trans-unit.target: The client credentials are not valid.

trans-unit.source: To fix, the application administrator updates the credentials.
trans-unit.target: To fix, the application administrator updates the credentials.

trans-unit.source: unsupported_grant_type
trans-unit.target: unsupported_grant_type

trans-unit.source: The authorization server does not support the authorization grant type.
trans-unit.target: The authorization server does not support the authorization grant type.

trans-unit.source: Change the grant type in the request.
trans-unit.target: Change the grant type in the request.

trans-unit.source: This type of error should occur only during development and be detected during initial testing.
trans-unit.target: This type of error should occur only during development and be detected during initial testing.

trans-unit.source: For information, see <link xlink:href="6c3e8f37-06ed-439e-bc2d-d6a318f32639" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Grant Flow</link> and <link xlink:href="6faab4b7-3c73-44df-b00d-fa517d1a1496" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service to Service Calls Using Client Credentials</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information, see <link xlink:href="6c3e8f37-06ed-439e-bc2d-d6a318f32639" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Grant Flow</link> and <link xlink:href="6faab4b7-3c73-44df-b00d-fa517d1a1496" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service to Service Calls Using Client Credentials</link>.

trans-unit.source: invalid_resource
trans-unit.target: invalid_resource

trans-unit.source: The target resource is invalid because it does not exist, Azure AD cannot find it, or it is not correctly configured.
trans-unit.target: The target resource is invalid because it does not exist, Azure AD cannot find it, or it is not correctly configured.

trans-unit.source: This indicates the resource has not been configured in the tenant.
trans-unit.target: This indicates the resource has not been configured in the tenant.

trans-unit.source: The application can prompt the user with instruction for installing the application and adding it to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The application can prompt the user with instruction for installing the application and adding it to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Application Access</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=286007%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Application Access</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=286007%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: interaction_required
trans-unit.target: interaction_required

trans-unit.source: The request requires user interaction.
trans-unit.target: The request requires user interaction.

trans-unit.source: For example, an additional authentication step is required.
trans-unit.target: For example, an additional authentication step is required.

trans-unit.source: Retry the request with the same resource.
trans-unit.target: Retry the request with the same resource.

trans-unit.source: temporarily_unavailable
trans-unit.target: temporarily_unavailable

trans-unit.source: The server is temporarily too busy to handle the request.
trans-unit.target: The server is temporarily too busy to handle the request.

trans-unit.source: Retry the request.
trans-unit.target: Retry the request.

trans-unit.source: The client application might explain to the user that its response is delayed due a temporary condition.
trans-unit.target: The client application might explain to the user that its response is delayed due a temporary condition.
